qas.question: What geopolitical entity emerged from the Late Middle Ages?
Which mountain range is seen as a dividing line when considering conditions during the Middle Ages?
The Renaissance is generally used to describe developments in what areas of life in the Middle Ages?
Which centuries are considered to be part of the Late Middle Ages?

answers.text: early 14th century up until – and sometimes including – the 16th century

qas.question: What was the general effect of the Late Middle Ages on religion?

answers.text: the end of western religious unity

qas.question: What geopolitical entity faded from the Late Middle Ages?
Which mountain range isn't seen as a dividing line when considering conditions during the Middle Ages?
The Renaissance is never used to describe developments in what areas of life in the Middle Ages?

plausible_answers.text: early 14th century up until – and sometimes including – the 16th century

qas.question: Which centuries are considered not to be part of the Late Middle Ages?

plausible_answers.text: the end of western religious unity

qas.question: What was the general effect of the Late Middle Ages on science?

context: Modern historiography on the period has reached a consensus between the two extremes of innovation and crisis. It is now (generally) acknowledged that conditions were vastly different north and south of <a1_0><b6_0>the Alps<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and "Late Middle Ages" is often avoided entirely within Italian historiography. The term "Renaissance" is still considered useful for describing certain <a2_0><b7_0>intellectual, cultural, or artistic<b7_0/><a2_0/> developments, but not as the defining feature of an entire European historical epoch. The period from the <a3_0><b8_0>early 14th century up until – and sometimes including – the 16th century<b8_0/><a3_0/>, is rather seen as characterised by other trends: demographic and economic decline followed by recovery, <a4_0><b9_0>the end of western religious unity<b9_0/><a4_0/> and the subsequent emergence of <a0_0><b5_0>the nation state<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and the expansion of European influence onto the rest of the world.
